title: Scouts ordered to find Ben Chilwell replacement as Man City or Chelsea exit accepted by Leicester
text:
Chilwell is a wanted man (Picture: Getty Images)

Brendan Rodgers has instructed scouts to find a replacement for Ben Chilwell as Leicester chiefs grow resigned he will complete a £50million transfer away from the club this summer.

Both Manchester City and Chelsea are plotting moves for the England international, who has been capped eight times by his country.

Pep Guardiola’s City looked at Chilwell over the summer and are thought to be interested in reigniting their interest given Benjamin Mendy’s struggles since arriving at the Etihad, while Frank Lampard views him as a long-term solution at left-back for Chelsea.

Brendan Rodgers accepts Chilwell may leave (Picture: Getty Images)

Chelsea can’t make a move for the 22-year-old before next summer due to a transfer ban, while City are unlikely to push for a deal in January but Leicester are still preparing for life beyond Chilwell, according to The Sun.

While their scouts draw up a list of potential recruits in the full-back role, one player who could be targeted in January is Bolton’s Ronan Darcy.

The 18-year-old attacker has impressed Leicester scouts and remains on their radar as they look to strengthen their squad mid-season.

It’s been an impressive start to the campaign for the Foxes.

They sit pretty in third place in the Premier League ahead of Sunday’s matches, although Arsenal and Chelsea could climb above them with wins over Bournemouth and Southampton.
